intro: Scabiosa atropurpurea var. grandiflora, commonly known as the sweet clover or redhead, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, pink to purple flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, which are characteristic of the Caprifoliaceae family. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged opposite each other along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and meadows. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
